alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:56PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong wind gusts are possible over portions of east central Stillwater, north central Carbon and southwestern Yellowstone Counties through 545 PM MDT... An area of weak thunderstorms continues to move across areas from Columbus through Billings, producing occasional strong wind gusts over 40 mph. The individual cells were moving northeast at 35 mph, but the line is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts 35 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Billings, Laurel, Lockwood, Huntley, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Worden, Billings West End, Ballantine, Molt, Silesia, Acton, Park City and Rockvale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. The strong wind gusts may move well away from the storm center and arrive before any rain falls or thunder is heard.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone
